data.title: It's just industrial Italian food
data.text: They take you through the kitchen on the way to your seat, don't care since I've seen kitchens before.  Food is nothing special, just standard industrial Italian fare.  Not a real favor of family style serving (everyone eats the same thing and served out of a big bowl or platter).  It it's your thing then it's okay but all in all there are better places.

data.title: Good food poor service
data.text: Took my daughter for her birthday dinner  at Buca di Beppo we were a party of six. Before we were seat I made sure to give the Host my reservation which came with a cake for my daughter. He assured me he tell the server. When we good out to eat Service to me is as important as good food. We had to ask our server several times for bread, she was very un-attentive to our party. Now the food, the Mussels Bianca was excellent. We also ordered a Large cheese pizza which is a must, taste better the next day. For dinner we had Penne ala Vodka, Eggplant Parmigiana, and Chicken Limone. All was excellent. At the end of dinner NO Cake!! Spoke to management as i was leaving only to be told he look into it. Not the answer I was expecting.

data.title: BUCA DI BEPPO-LA BIGGA MISTAKE-A
data.text:
Went here for first time yesterday evening for a family's 60th birthday. It all started when we were being rushed through the kitchen by a pushy waiter that was behind us. After seating, the only thing worse than the service was the management.

To start, we never received our Garlic bread and was told that the printer made an error and did not print. Then one of the salads showed up with no dressing on it at all. Then the broccoli that I ordered steamed came out raw and without the lemon that we asked for twice. Then the chicken Parm plate did not show up and I had to get up, march into the kitchen and demand to speak to a manager telling them that I want the plate now. They came out with the plate and we were told some story that it was not made right so they had to remake it. The other 1/2 of our party did not receive their veal parm plate and we again demanded a manager. The manager came out and stated that there was an error with the printer and it did not print and we had to wait again.

This was a terrible experience and the staff was horrible. Had to hunt them down. Ruined the birthday experience.

With so many other choices in South Florida don't waste your time.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are sorry to hear about your recent experience, this is certainly not the impression we want our guests to leave with. We pride ourselves in delivering great service, food, and overall dining atmosphere. We really do appreciate your feedback and hope you give us the chance to make it right! Please reply to my direct message so we can reach out to you.
Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Top best Italian cuisine
data.text: Food is outstanding, very generous portions, excellent atmosphere and great service! Perfect for any occasions. Most visit if you want true Italian cuisine

data.title: Mrs. Gabriele
data.text:
Went for dinner. Ordered Chicken Marsala. 
Sauce was very dark in color and tasted sweet. We didn't say anything to the the other people at our table. As the food made it around the table, others stated how sweet the marsala was. One said it tasted like it was sweetened with pancake syrup. 
We've tried this place a few years ago with family and were disappointed then. This time we met a group of friends. For sure, my husband and I will never go back.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review as our customer’s feedback is very important to us. We apologize the food was not up to our usual standards. We will certainly contact management and make them aware of the situation to ensure it does not reoccur in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bland
data.text: Worst, most tasteless and bland Italian food I have had in years. The wait staff and atmoshere are nice, and the portion sizes are great (very large) for the price, but it's like they are afraid to use any seasonings in their food. If you want good Italian food in the area, try Sal's or Ciro's instead for some good flavorful cuisine. Even the sauce I buy at the store is better than at Buca di Peppo. Big Skip.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm truly sorry to hear that our food quality was not up to par. We appreciate your taking the time to do this review as it will only help us improve ourselves and target our problem areas. If you're willing to let us make it up to you, please reply to my private message.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Huge portions and good food!
data.text: I really don't like Italian food but I bought a groupon and was really impressed when I got the meal. Taste and portion was great!!

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so happy to hear you gave us a try and enjoyed your time with us! We do hope you visit us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Family friendly
data.text:
This is just the most fun place to eat. You are escorted to your table through the kitchen surrounded by the most fun eclectic bunch of pictures you will ever see in a restaurant. Don't forget to see the Pope room.
     The food is family style and more that any group can consume with out being stuffed.
    After you are fully sated on the best home style Italian food you will eat, you might need help to get on your feet,loosining your belt will help.
    Don't forget to visit the ladies and mens rooms as well.
    A bit pricy but well worth every cent. A wonderful experience.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are happy to hear of the great time you had at Buca di Beppo.  We are known to have very generous portions and make sure no one goes home hungry! We look forward to celebrating with you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Incredible
data.text: The decor of Buca is really cool, we were given a tour of the whole restaurant  for the rest rooms to the kitchen with a booth for dining to Pope  room .The portions are huge ,plenty to share or take home the leftovers.  Excellent  Food.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for the great feedback! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your time at Buca di Beppo and we hope to celebrate with you again really soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Place for Lunch
data.text: You can't beat the lunch here if you are hungry. They give you so much great food you might need to take some home. The value is good and the food is really good.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback! We try to make sure no one goes home hungry!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice regional management but food and service not worth the money.
data.text:
First in my usual tradition I always try and go twice to a restaurant prior to reviewing it. I had been to a Buca di Beppo before (fifteen years ago) in Cincinnati Ohio and; although it wasn't anything to write home about, it was passable because of the food was slightly above average but, the service and atmosphere were enthusiastic and fun - really made the place.  This Buca di Beppo in Davie, Florida had none of that and made my mothers 95th birthday a great disappointment. 

What went wrong?  We went on a Groupon the first time but because it was my mothers 95th birthday purchased the $30 dessert and had entrees that exceeded the Groupon so to give back a little to the restaurant ( we know Groupons can hurt the bottomline!)  The portions are large when it comes to the pastas but the veal saltebucco was tough and a standard portion.  When we mentioned the veal was overcooked to the waitress she said sorry and that was it - not exactly how restaurants who wish to survive should respond.  The bread; which they point out in the beginning is made daily, is a waste of calories (worth what you pay for it - nothing) and the dessert was enormous and tasted pre-made and boxed.  We left.  The next day we called the restaurant and asked to speak to the manager he wasn't available so we left a message.  After two days with no response from the manager we called corporate as: having owned two restaurants, I know that it is important to get back to customers and thought that now upper management should know.  

Within an hour I had a call from the manager of the local restaurant and then a call from the Vice President of the region at Corporate.  The manager; frankly, needs to polish his skills a bit but; and the reason I gave the restaurant two stars and not one, the regional Vice President knew his stuff and was very accommodating and interested in what we had to say.  Frankly all we wanted was to tell him our experience in a hope it would help them and we weren't looking for anything.  As it turned out though he sent a small token of his appreciation for the feedback and we returned to try it again before writing this review - hoping it was not the restaurant and just a bad night we experienced prior.  

Second (and last) try for the restaurant.  We went on a Thursday evening early so we would avoid a busy time.  Reception still lack luster and with no real enthusiasm, service better then the first time but still lacking knowledge, finesse and enthusiasm.  We ordered pasta thinking that may be their schtick, it isn't - my ravioli was a big pocket of dough and tasteless cheese filling (Stouffer's anyone??). I added the meatball which was good and tender - $6.00 extra for the one meatball.  The seafood pasta; which is supposed to be filled with mussels, calamari, clams, shrimp, scallops etc, had overcooked pasta, noticeable mussels, canned clams (chopped), tiny shrimp and not many, very little calamari (2 small pieces!) and no scallops (although their version doesn't advertise it on their menu so although most of the traditional Fruit de Mar's we have had would have them we can't expect it here - the price $28.00 expensive for what we received.  We also had soup and for dessert cannoli for dessert. The bill was close to $100 for two people and just not worth it. Sad to say as I really enjoyed the one in Cincinnati.  

This restaurant needs an overhaul in most every department.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so sorry to hear you did not have a good experience both times you visited our Davie location. We pride ourselves in delivering great service, food quality, and overall fun dining atmosphere and certainly would not like to leave such a bad impression. We would love if you gave us one more try. If you could please reply to my private message we will contact you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: So So
data.text: I found their food not remember able. Their prices are high for what you get. Their service is slow.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We apologize you did not have a great experience at Buca di Beppo. We pride ourselves in delivering great service, food quality, and overall fun dining atmosphere. If you'd like we would like to have a chance to make things right. Please reply to my direct message so we can reach out to you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Just alright
data.text: Everyone was very nice.  The red sauce wasn't that good.  Sorta tasted like they made their "own" from a jar or can.  I'm pretty sure they do have good things on the menu, I just didn't order something I liked.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback! I'm sorry to hear you did not enjoy our freshly made marinara sauce. We do hope you come again and try some of our other delicious options!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun! Quirky, with good food
data.text: The thing I like best about BDB is the eclectic Italian environment.  The first time we ate at a BDB was in Houston.  The experience was so relaxed and fun; returning home to Ft. Lauderdale we discovered one within 5 miles of our house.  A pleasant surprise.  This is a family or party place.  Love getting friends together for dinner there; around a big round table, or long skinny one.  There are many small dining rooms, so you're not in a big cavernous place.  It gives the illusion of a much smaller restaurant.  If you're LUCKY, you might even snag the table in the kitchen.  That's always a favorite.  You actually sit in a round booth, facing the cooks in the kitchen.  The kids especially like it.  It can get noisy, but that's part of the charm.  I come from an Italian family, so laughter and noise is expected around the dinner table. Many of the dishes are  served family style (if you like) with enough servings to go around.  It's not gourmet, but it is Italian. The photos on the wall are intriguing - and I could swear some of my relatives have been framed and hung there. All the rooms have names, and in addition to the kitchen booth, there is also a very large round table, all by itself in the "Pope's Room."  So go!  Enjoy!  Mangia!  Mangia!

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Ciao! I am so happy to hear you had a great time at Buca di Beppo! We pride ourselves in delivering great service, food, and overall fun dining atmosphere. Thank you for your positive review and we hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to Socialize
data.text:
As a family we really enjoy coming here.  The picture decorations leads to very interesting topics of discussion.

Variety of food is good and we do like to share the family style meals.

We have taken out food too, and does not compromise to what you get when sitting down.

Service has never been a problem.

It is not too loud, you can actually have a discussion.

Price is good for what you get.

Would definitely recommend it.

data.title: Great Italian in davie.
data.text: Service was better than expected. We were a big group.  We tried several dishes. My favorites were the seafood platter, the stuffed meatballs (bucannoli), and the spicy arrabiata pizza. I recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great Italian food for a family event
data.text: Many Italian favorites here, including lasagna, baked rigatoni (my favorite, it is spicy) calamari for my appetizer of course. Have to have a cannoli  or tiramisu for dessert. Need better coffee though I have to say! Some nice expresso would do! Service is good! Wish they also served individual size dishes to! Portions are big!

data.title: Food for Two or More
data.text: Buca di Beppo is really an experience.  Every room is tailored to a specific theme and makes for an interesting dining experience.  The meals are meant to be shared so be ready to take leftovers home.  Make sure to checkout on-line coupons.  The servers are extremely attentive and readily accommodate any request.  Would recommend if you're looking for good Italian food.

data.title: Bring your friends and come hungry
data.text: We had a family celebration here and it was well worth it for us to travel from Miami for it. The food is ordered in large plates for up to 5 people and then you share with everyone. We ordered 3 different types of pasta and 2 salad trays and everything was delicious, specially the penne pasta which had a delicious spice. We were seated in a room with decorations resembling the Vatican,  quite neat. The place was packed mid afternoon so make sure you make reservations well in advance.

data.title: Best Italian Food around
data.text: I went here for the first time and have to say that the food was delicious. Like little Italy. Don't let the fact that it is a chain make you think that this is like Olive Garden. It is not. Everything tasted like it was cooked up in an Italian Grandma's kitchen.
